TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PagedControl extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Functions as a base class used by controls that support internal pagination. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl> class exposes certain properties, methods, and events common to all controls that are capable of internal pagination.
All controls that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl> class also support custom pagination, known as chunking.
Similar to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ItemPager> class, this class is used for controls that have long text length, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.LiteralText>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets the first item visible on the current form page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The first item visible on the current form page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the control is not visible on the current form page, this value is -1.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The number of items in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Classes that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl> must override this inherited property.
The difference between the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.InternalItemCount%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase.Count%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> classes is that if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.InternalItemCount%2A> property is called before the control view state is loaded, it returns the number of items in the view state, unlike the behavior of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase.Count%2A> property, which returns zero.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the count of items in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The count of items in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Custom pagination must be enabled. The default is 0, indicating that you cannot use custom paging.
The units used for an item depend on the control. For example, a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control might use list items as units, whereas a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> control might use characters.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of items displayed per page after pagination. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The number of items displayed per page after pagination.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If zero, pagination is not affected by this property. If nonzero, overrides items displayed per page when the form is paginated. The default value is zero.
Mobile controls that support internal pagination also provide a feature called custom pagination. Normally, such controls require you to provide all the data that they can display. Developers specify the total number of items that are in the list in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.ItemCount%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.ItemsPerPage%2A> property specifies how many items the control displays per page.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.ItemsPerPage%2A> property to render eight items of a 200-item list per page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MobileLoadListEventArgsSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileLoadListEventArgsSample/cs/default.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MobileLoadListEventArgsSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileLoadListEventArgsSample/vb/default.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets the approximate weight of a single item in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The approximate weight of a single item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. The inheriting class must override this property. For further information about overriding this property, see [Pagination Support](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/78f2786d-0b5b-4760-9616-5027357713c2).
## Examples The following code example creates and uses a custom list control. The example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.ItemWeight%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> class to specify a new control weight.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MobilePagedControlSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobilePagedControlSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MobilePagedControlSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobilePagedControlSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Occurs when a control is custom-paginated and needs more data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When control is custom-paginated, you do not explicitly bind the control. After pagination, the control raises this event, indicating what part of the data is required. The application can handle this event and bind the control with the required data.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.ItemsPerPage%2A> property to render eight items of a 200-item list per page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MobileLoadListEventArgsSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileLoadListEventArgsSample/cs/default.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MobileLoadListEventArgsSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileLoadListEventArgsSample/vb/default.aspx#1)] -->

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl.LoadItems> event. Inheriting classes can override this method to retrieve the required data.

Gets the number of items that are visible on the current ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The number of items that are visible on the current ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the control is not visible at all on the current form page, this value is 0.
